New Records: The St. Louis Cardinals achieved their first regular-season win at Yankee Stadium since 1964
Key Match Events: Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer in the third inning
Ryan Helsley recorded his first save in the Bronx since 1964
The game went into the ninth inning with a tense finish
Post-Match Reflections: Donovan expressed pride in the team's historical win
Ryan Helsley became the first Cardinal to record a save in the Bronx since 1964
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals improved to 1-7 at Yankee Stadium in the regular season
The game was significant for its historical context
